I've just returned my mail-in ballot for tomorrow’s primary election in NJ. Your ballot must be postmarked by July 7th or you can use one of the designated drop boxes in your county. You can find a drop box in your county here: https://www.state.nj.us/state/elections/assets/pdf/election-results/2020/2020-drop-box-locations.pdf http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1280155923491762178/img/bLezQUROv3yq1GIC.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1280155923491762178/vid/480x270/Tp-h_jM8QQ-of1tS.mp4?tag=13

Glad to hear you’re doing well, @BillPascrell. I would expect nothing less from one of the toughest fighters New Jersey has. Wishing you a speedy recovery! #JerseyStrong https://twitter.com/BillPascrell/status/1280147101423489024 QT @BillPascrell My outstanding #Paterson @sjh_nj doctors expect me to make a complete speedy recovery.

I’m feeling *much* better and I’m eager to get back at it. It’ll take a lot more to stop me. #JerseyStrong 💪🏾

The temperature in Siberia is 100 degrees, wildfires are raging there and sea ice is melting. In the midst of all the other crises we face, we cannot forget climate change. We must transform our energy system away from fossil fuel to energy efficiency and sustainable energy. Now!

Meanwhile, 440,000 Black-owned small businesses are expected to close—think of how many this could have helped.
https://twitter.com/JakeSherman/status/1280171124995706881 QT @JakeSherman The Prime Rib — a DC steakhouse on K Street — got a PPP loan for between $2 million and $5 million.

I introduced legislation with @AyannaPressley, @KarenBassTweets, @RobinLynneKelly, and @BLeeForCongress to demand the release of coronavirus demographic data. NYT had to sue the CDC for access. It shouldn’t be this hard to get public health data to ensure an equitable response.

Coronavirus isn’t just exposing the racial disparities in our health care system—it’s making them worse. 

Any meaningful response to this pandemic must address this harmful reality head-on. 
https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/07/05/us/coronavirus-latinos-african-americans-cdc-data.html

Vanessa Guillén's family deserves answers and accountability for her murder. I fully support an independent investigation into the circumstances of her disappearance and death.

Our bill will help these businesses get the resources they need to survive this economic downturn. https://www.sbc.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/pressreleases?ID=999CE328-3738-40FC-A4C0-2F8760F8E59A

Trump's pathological lying never stops. While he continues to tell us how great the "recovery" is doing, the pandemic surges and millions face hunger, eviction and loss of health care. Together, we'll defeat Trump. Together, we'll move this country in a very different direction.

Inequality is making this pandemic worse for working people in America—and unless our government takes meaningful steps to reduce inequality and eliminate the racial wealth gap, it will also make it much harder for our economy to recover from this crisis.
https://abcnews.go.com/Business/extreme-inequality-preexisting-condition-covid-19-widened-americas/story?id=71401975

RT @SenGillibrand We need systemic reform to address sexual assault in the military. Every year, I've fought to pass the Military Justice Improvement Act that would fix this issue and give service members an unbiased, impartial justice system. 

Every year, it's denied a vote in the Senate. (2/4)

Vanessa Guillen served her country and her community. She deserved better, and her loved ones deserve justice.

We need a thorough investigation—and an overhaul of the military’s handling of sexual harassment and assault.

#JusticeForVanessaGuillen https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1280149519506845697 QT @nytimes “People can go missing for years, and having no answers is much worse than having the answer,” said Marya Guillen, the sister of Specialist Vanessa Guillen, the Fort Hood soldier who went missing in April https://trib.al/E7UbGtQ

Communities across the country are calling for real reforms to end the systemic racism that plagues policing in America. That starts with holding officers & police depts with a history of racist/discriminatory policing accountable. Congress must pass our bill to do just that.

The Enhancing Oversight to End Discrimination in Policing Act would:
✅ Rescind the Sessions limits on the use of consent decrees
✅ Empower state AGs to pursue pattern or practice investigations
✅ Triple funding for DOJ’s @CivilRights Division to pursue these cases

Under Obama, @TheJusticeDept investigated racist policing & forced police depts to reform. Trump's DOJ made it harder to enter into these consent decrees. So @RepRichmond, @SenatorDurbin, @maziehirono & I have a bill to strengthen these investigations. https://www.warren.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/senators-warren-durbin-hirono-and-congressman-richmond-introduce-legislation-to-investigate-and-hold-police-officers-and-departments-accountable-for-discriminatory-practices

Absurd that Andrés Guardado was killed by sheriffs on June 18 and his family still hasn’t seen the results of his autopsy. Officials must release the autopsy immediately.

And I’ll say it again: we need an independent investigation into why sheriffs used deadly force. https://twitter.com/nbcnews/status/1278197912917479429 QT @NBCNews The family of Andrés Guardado is urging Los Angeles county officials to release the autopsy report after the young Latino was fatally shot by a sheriff's deputy. https://nbcnews.trib.al/rJ4JEOV - @NBCLatino

The Affordable Care Act is benefitting millions of Americans, and its destruction would have a devastating impact on low-income communities, people with preexisting conditions, seniors, and people of color. 

Yet Trump is actively trying to dismantle the ACA during a pandemic.

Our government didn't have a stabilization and recovery plan when Wall Street crashed our economy in 2008, or when COVID-19 crashed our economy again in 2020. It’s long past time to prepare in advance for downturns and invest in economic resilience. https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/07/01/opinion/case-economic-emergency-break-glass/

The expansion of unemployment benefits during COVID-19 has been a lifeline for families and for the economy. A fair wage guarantee is one powerful way we can keep helping workers, employers, and our economy recover when it’s safe to return to work. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/05/opinion/unemployment-benefits-coronavirus.html
